content:
I'd like to ask for an exemption to the Substantiative deadline for 2 specific changes to vocab resources:

- there is an approved task which turned out to have editorial issues that need to go back to committee to discussion (defining implicit operations on CodeSystem resource - appears to need a new element on the resource to resolve) Note: as far as I know there are no profiles on code system for this ballot

- there is a task that is not yet approved that requires the addition of a new parameters on the $expand operation on ValueSet.

These will both be discussed and approved (or not) by Vocab prior to the total freeze

The ballot desktop lists, as one of the ballots opening:

  • HL7 FHIRÂ® Profile: Occupational Data for Health (ODH), Release 1

Does anyone know what makes this a 'profile' as opposed to an implementation guide? Does anyone what the state of this is?
in fact, so far as I can see, it's not approved. What happens now?
ok. Core is posted. I have built the 8 IGs that will also be balloted at this time, and I'm waiting for history notes on 3-4 of them before going ahead and posting them
this process was messy. I spent more than a day correcting basic missing stuff in the IGs that editors should do. I drafted this for the next time around:

we may want to extend the breadth of this document; many IG authors were caught by surprise by parts of the process that I didn't document in this page - reconcilation requirements, deadlines in the this page: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_Ballot_Prep
generally, we need to do this better in the future
I'll be asking IG authors doing publishing in round #2 of this publishing cycle to follow this (to late for some of it, of course)
